properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. The Ministry of Environment & Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with the Interior Health Authority has issued a Dust Advisory for Golden due to high concentrations of dust that are expected to persist today. This advisory will be updated today. Exposure is particularly a concern for pregnant women, infants, the elderly and those who have underlying medical conditions such as breathing or lung conditions, hay fever, asthma or persons who react strongly to dust. If you are experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheeze, follow the advice of your health care provider. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-landwater/ air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-02-23T04:10:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2020-02-22T12:33:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1455453814.2020
Area: East Columbia
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Hamlet Of Sunset View Beach Located In The R.m. Of Mervin No. 499
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Hamlet of Sunset View Beach located in the R.M. of Mervin No. 499. The advisory is for the entire Hamlet of Sunset View Beach and for any individuals who may access the Sunset View Beach water system. The advisory is in effect until March 2nd, 2020.
Expires: 2020-03-06T11:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Turtleford and RM of Mervin, 2020-02-21T11:22:05-06:00, E55860F8-8A52-A1C9-A5F4-9492D55EC6B7
Area: R.M. of Mervin No. 499
properties.Author: SK Turtleford and RM of Mervin

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-23T08:15:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-22T16:15:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2832577363.2020
Area: Iqaluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. ROAD DUST ADVISORY CONTINUED FOR VERNON (February 21, 2020 - Vernon) The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Interior Health has issued a Dust Advisory for Vernon on 2020/02/18. The advisory remains in effect due to high concentrations of dust that are expected to persist today. This advisory will be updated today or when conditions have improved. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise near busy roads until the advisory is lifted. Exposure is particularly a concern for infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at: https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-02-23T04:31:47-00:00
